reviewText: The first dvd is, to a large extent, about trendy, shallow, selfish Chinese artists who are currently making a good living in Shanghai and could care less about the multitudes of people who were ruthlessly displaced, so they could enjoy the good life in a brand new high rise apartment. How trivial and disgusting!
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts

reviewText: - The reenactment  looks real.- There are interviews with scholars at real historical sites of the Great Wall.- The documentary also reveals the social impact on the lives of the builders of the Great Wall.- The downside is there is no subtitle.  It`s very frustrating because I want to do more research on some of the archaeological sites, Ming kings and generals  but I can`t spell their names!In short, if you like the Great Wall, you don`t want to miss this DVD set.
summary: Interesting document about the Great Wall due to real-looking reenactment.
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts

reviewText: This documentary provides a good overview of the recent industrialization of China.  The travel videos focus on tourist sites but this one looks at a sample of the people who make up the majority of Chinese.  In this way, this series is very complementary to tourism and history videos.The new wealth is juxtaposed with some severe and deeply unfair pollution incidents.  China's industrial rise has not only cost a good number of American manufacturing jobs, it isn't easy on the average Chinese worker or farmer who is losing farmland, clean water, or healthy air.  In this video you get a close-up look at the pro's and con's of industrialization.  It's vivid, and good to see in the video.  It leaves me with mixed feelings about trying to ever take a vacation in China, and more like the 19th century  travel writer described by the author Alain de Botton as one who preferred reading travelogues to actually visiting the sites.  Still, for adventurous and highly physically fit tourists China can be a great destination.
summary: A look beyond the headlines about Chinese culture and people
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts

reviewText: The Discovery Channel produces some good films. China is becoming a global world power and this is a nice introduction to understanding China's continue influence on the rest of the world. This film is very informative on China's society and culture. Some of this material may have been presented on other DVD's but if you have not seen them yet this is a good film to start your understanding about China. I recommend it for the educational value.
summary: It a better understanding of China
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts

reviewText: This was a very interesting DVD. Not only the information on the Great Wall but also of it's people.
summary: Great DVD for the Great Wall
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts

reviewText: Really helps you to understand where the Chineses have come from there struggles and challenges in the current century and where they are trying to go.  Excellent for researching the country before you go to China or while you are threre.
Title: China Rises: A Documentary in Four Parts
